data.text: Need a Good Tent for Two People for our Bicycle Tour

Hello everyone, My girlfriend and I are looking for a tent for our next bicycle tour, would any of you have a suggestion for a good tent? It would be for the 2 of us, and ideally muted colors to not attract too much attention and some space under the fly for bags. We were looking at the Big Agnes Blacktail 2 Bike packing tent, but haven't been able to find one in stock in the past months. Thanks so much! Any thoughts are appreciated. Mori
MSR Hubba Hubba NX. 2 person tent, comes in dark green. Weighs just under 2kg
data.author: Sol Findley
Sol Findley

data.text: naturehike mongar 2. Almost the same as msr, but much cheaper.
data.author: Vaidotas Pe

data.text: best tent there is!
data.author: Julia Eekels

data.text: i used this in Hot climates it‚Äôs great but in rain it leaked ..was I just unlucky ?

data.text: Mongar or Hubba?
data.author: Mikkel √òrstedholm

data.text: depends on the year. They stopped seam sealing and did a recall. They are seam sealing again following all the complaints. It was the 2019 that leaked.
data.author: Sue Chapple

data.text: hubba!
data.author: Julia Eekels

data.text: I had an MSR Elixir, seam seal, treated but it was still leaking. The drops go through the mesh and my sleeping bag was getting wet. Bought a Hillberg... :)
data.author: Camoma Cara

data.text: impossible I have both. MSR is great. Very good against rain. Has a clever rainrail as well. Maybe it was condensation or something. I live in a rainy climate.
data.author: Pelle Pelle

data.text: Big Agnes Fly Creek or Copper Spur? Both have Bikepack versions.
data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text: I'll second the copper spur. Big Agnes makes amazing tents. two vestibules, one for each of you. go for the three person and have even more room inside?
data.author: Brent Joly

data.text: - My partner and I have been using the Naturehike 3 person copy. It's been great, but is getting to the end of it's life. We'll be picking up a Copper Spur before our next big adventure unless something else better comes along. üëç
data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text: And I'll second what Brent just said. Big Agnes has the best solutions for tents...
data.author: Luiz Andrade

data.text: but no floor in the vestibule?
data.author: Sue Chapple

data.text: Big Agnes gear is really light but definitely not expedition grade. I had one that worked great for about two months then started to leak and fall apart. Great for short trips if you are looking for something lightweight. I replaced the Big Agnes with MSR Hubba Hubba and have been really happy with that ever since. I also have a bomb proof Hilleberg that is great but heavy.
data.author: Steve Hiniker

data.text: - Did you contact Big Agnes? Their customer service and warranty is amazing. That's one of the main selling points of their gear. Might be worth chasing them up if you haven't gotten rid of the tent already.
data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text:

data.text: Thumbs up for the Gossamer tent I've got the 1 man version. They are not the lightest of tents though

data.text: Jack wolfskin have a shop in Ambleside.
data.author: Kate Rhodes

data.text: We use a cheap vango, big enough to put the bikes inside for security.
data.author: Kate Rhodes

data.text: The military are quite keen on Jack wolfskin. I've always found the cut to be nice and very durable. The Germans wear it because they can afford quality. New Vango is utter rubbish, nothing like the older gear.
data.author: Monika Cognomen

data.text: I was surprised by the tents quality from decathlon. We used the tent for our trip in south america. Had previously a cuben fibre tent but their was to much condensation in it.
data.author: Christian Tydecks

data.text: we also have the Decathlon Quickhiker tent which is great value and very light. But it's an all in one type which means that in hot weather you can't just put the inner up

data.text: oh, i can have mine errected without outer shell.

data.text: Thoroughly tested a two person Marmot this last week in torrential (I mean biblical) downpour. Bone dry. Very impressed with a tent that cost about $220 Canadian.
data.author: Trevor Hughes

data.text: That is worth knowing Sounds brilliant and just what we need in UK
data.author: Sandra Sowerbutts

data.text: we have used a Marmot Limelight 3 for the past 12 years touring on and off, a tad heavy but it‚Äôs been an amazing tent, it has never let us down, I think it‚Äôs been replaced by the Marmot Tungsten model now, friends have the Marmot Vapor model which has less mesh and is a bit warmer for U.K. weather

data.text: Also they are self supporting tents a big plus

data.text: Thank you for that all this info is great

data.text: used it last week on a tour of Belguim, it‚Äôs still going strong! üèï

data.text: We've got a new msr elixir 2,plenty of space for 2 people, 2 doors and 2 large vestibules. Head space is great too

data.text: Take a look at vaude .look at self supporting one then if can‚Äôt get pegs in you are still able to sleep inside . Notice some need lots of pegs which is fine if ground is soft .We travelled for 2 years and used vaude Mark 3 . Look at height as you may have to stay in tent so it‚Äôs good if you can sit up too ..

data.text: Try the Vango range, reasonable prices. Depends on what you're gonna use it for and when. No point spending a fortune on a 3 to 4 season tent you only use in good weather.
data.author: Donald Canard

data.text: Nah, their quality has plummeted. I have an big old dome and it's excellent but too big for a bike. Bought a smaller one for a nine month Europe trip and it was a bloody nemesis. Next time, I'm getting an msr and sod the expense.
data.author: Monika Cognomen

data.text: Well hush my mouth.
data.author: Donald Canard

data.text: I really like to use a light 3 person tent between 2 while bike touring. In wet weather it can really nice to have the extra space for very little weight gain. All of the big Agnes bikepacking tents have super short poles which is think is really important on a bike. The tiger wall 3 bikepack is only 1.5kg (plus a ground sheet)
data.author: Jon Belt

data.text: that's a good idea to look into a 3 person, thanks!
data.author: Mori Hays

data.text: Big Agnes is to light and flimsy. MSR Hubba Hubba nx 2 person is a good choice.
data.author: Javier Col√≥n

data.text:
Have a look at the Robens range: https://www.robens.de/en-gb/shop/outdoor-tents Generally, if you want a 2 person tent, buy a 3 person tent. No matter how much you love someone, having them snoring 2 inches from your ear all night can become wearisomeüò¥

data.text: I really like NatureHike because they seem to be relatively good quality but cheap! I have NH Star River 2 (too small for 2 people), but for example the Cloud Peak 2 should be a bit roomier. Or take a 3 person tent ofcourse

data.text: I would avoid big Agnes. Had one of their tents fall apart on me, holes forming everywhere in the netting and zippers failing.

data.text: - Which model and year?

data.text: it was older 2016 I think copper spur ul1. It's a well-known problem though, big Agnes tends to use shitty zippers. MSR, while heavier tend to be higher quality tents

data.text: We have the Wechsel Forum 42. It has 2 entrances and you can keep your bags under the fly. We are loving it.

data.text: Hey guys, unless you 2 are going to be camping for the winter also I would try to find a 3 season water proof and at least a 3 person tent.

data.text: We use and recommended the Hilleberg Staika. 4 season & has self supported option in most conditions as well as stays for rougher weather.
data.author: Doomadgee NQ

data.text: Sling Fin Portal. Not cheap but GRT tent. You have to order a few months in advance. I think they only make them twice a year.
data.author: Eddie Aceves

data.text: I am with hilleberg so..... Other tents are not interesting for me. I have already reached the center of the target
data.author: St√©phane Sint√®s

data.text: Wild Country Helm 2. If you are in a wet climate its well worth avoiding tents in which you have to pitch the inner tent first. It might be the most waterproof tent in the world, but if it gets soaking wet inside every time you pitch or strike camp in the rain then it won't be very useful. There seem to be a lot of fair weather campers in the USA and a lot of tents designed to meet their needs, but remember that they probably won't meet yours
data.author: Chris AD

data.text: Get a "3-person" for 2 people. The personage rating presumes lying head-to-toe with nary any space between or beside.
data.author: Mike Dannheim

data.text: Although we use an Allak 3 Hilleberg our MSR Elixer 3 p was just as good not to expensive light and strong. Very often used by worldtravelers.
data.author: Pelle Pelle
